reviewText: The main event was Dude Love vs. Stone Cold and it was great. It made main events what they are today. I recomend this tape for the match ALONE!
summary: Undercard was nothing, but the main event was something!
Title: WWF In Your House 22 - Over The Edge VHS

reviewText: This is the show that continues the McMahon/Austin feud, and has a pretty famous main event.  Onward and in no particular order.L.O.D. 2000 vs. D.O.A. - Mmmm.  Thin Sunny.  Drool.  Bad match.  L.O.D. lost it long ago and D.O.A. never had it. *Farooq "injures" The Rock.  Rock won't be able to compete tonight.  Hah.TAKA/Bradshaw vs. Kaientai - Taka was over at this point and feuding with former friends Kaientai.  Bradshaw wasn't really doing anything at this point so he joined in.  The story is Kaientai matches blow for blow with Taka but runs every time Bradshaw gets in.  It's pretty funny and makes for a good match when Taka matches up with the very talented Kaientai. ***Marc Mero makes his wife a bigger star than he was by turning on her.Vader vs. Kane (Mask vs. Mask) Vader had been unmasked several times and Kane was in the midst of a big run.  You figure it out.  *1/2IC Title - Rock vs. Farooq - Former NOD leader Farooq challenges up-and-comer Rocky Maivia.  Rock is ordered to come out and defend the title or lose it.  The Nation interferes. **1/2 for the whole storyline.D-X vs. N.O.D. - Triple H was transitioning from a feud with Owen to a feud with the Rock.  D-X repeatedly made fun of the Nation and this match is pretty good.  Owen ruled the world and everyone else tried to keep up. ***WWF Title - Austin vs. Dude Love - Dude had sold out to McMahon long ago.  Vince is the ref, Pat Patterson the ring announcer, and Gerald Brisco the timekeeper.  Undertaker is at ringside to counter any shenanigans.  The storyline here is that Dude keeps cheating to gain an advantage because he can't win a fair fight, so McMahon keeps changing the rules of the match.  Brisco and Patterson get theirs and so does McMahon.  ****3/4.  This is a perfect example of ECW-style overbooking creating a great match instead of overshadowing it.In the End: Solid PPV with a great main event.  Get it for the main event alone and get everything from Wrestlemania 14 to Summerslam 1998 to get an idea of the atmosphere and storytelling of the time.  Recommended.
Title: WWF In Your House 22 - Over The Edge VHS

reviewText: The deck was stacked in this one as the WWF Championship goes on the line in a rematch from Unforgiven.  Champion-Stone Cold Steve Austin (HELL NO!) defends the title against Dude Love.  Vince McMahon is the guest referee  while Pat Patterson is the special ring announcer and Gerald Brisco is the  special timekeeper.  This match is loaded with action.  A great six-man tag  team war between D-Generation X (WWF European Champion-HHH and WWF Tag Team  Champions-New Age Outlaws) and The Nation (Owen Hart, D-Lo Brown, and  "The Godfather" Kama Mustafa.)  The WWF Intercontinental Title is  on the line between Champion-The Rock and Challenger-Faarooq.  Sable tries  to win her own freedom by going one on one with Marvelous Marc Mero.  Mask  vs. Mask=Vader vs. Kane.  L.O.D. 2000 and Droz take on D.O.A.(Skull,  8-Ball, and Chanz.)  Plus in a bonus match, WWF Light Heavyweight  Champion-Taka Michinoku teams with Bradshaw to take on Kaientai in a  special handicap match.  This is a good event to see because almost every  WWF superstar is involved.
Title: WWF In Your House 22 - Over The Edge VHS

reviewText: L.O.D v. D.O.A was very cool with high flyin stunts.Double J v. Blackman really sucked.Sable v. Mero was way too short.Kienti v. Bradshaw and Taka was one was the Best.Rock v.Farouq was another showstopper.Kane v. Vader  was a very boring match up.DX v. Nation was Okay.Austinv. dude love was the  best.Buy it!!
Title: WWF In Your House 22 - Over The Edge VHS

reviewText: The build up to this pay-per-view was brilliant, McMahon announcing that Austin would defend his title against the no.1 contender, to be decided. In  the end Vinnie Mc would have Dude Love and Chainsaw Charlie (aka Terry  Funk) battle it out on RAW in a brutal match and if Dude wins he goes on to  Over the Edge to face Austin. He does. To make sure a repeat of the events  at last months Unforgiven don't take place and Austin retains the title,  McMahon appoints himself the Special Guest Referee with the Stooges being  made Guest Ring Announcer and Time Keeper. The odds are stacked against the  Texas Rattlesnake going in to the event making a brilliant match that has a  killer ending. Again McMahon steals the show when he gets his butt kicked  by Austin, nobody seems to take a Stone Cold Stunner better then he does!
summary: Looking Over the Edge of the WWF cliff...
Title: WWF In Your House 22 - Over The Edge VHS

reviewText: Hello out there I am sure you know what this is this is a review where I go back & review an old school wrestling Pay Per View. I am reviewing Over The Edge In Your House. Now I am sure you found this review randomly or you happen to be reading this cause you never got to experience The Attitude Era or like me you grew up watching wrestling around this time period of 97 & 98 & just prefer talking about the past over what is going on in wrestling today. Now as always I mention the events leading into the important matches. So what has happened since Unforgiven. On The May 4th episode of RAW IS WAR Mick Foley was upset that Vince McMahon made him wrestle as Dude Love & that McMahon is punishing him cause he didn't win The WWF title at Unforgiven & he put him in a Hardcore Match with Terry Funk. McMahon told him that it wasn't a punishment it was reward cause if he destroy's Terry Funk then he will get another shot at The WWF Championship at Over The Edge. Now as you should all know Terry Funk & Mick Foley are friends so it added some interest to the match. Foley beat funk in a Hardcore Match & Vince McMahon showed up on the stage with The Dudettes it was revealed to be a conspiracy all this time. The following week on RAW IS WAR Vince McMahon had Mick Foley in a suit then McMahon stacked the deck against Stone Cold Steve Austin he announced that Gerald Brisco would be The Special Guest Time Keeper Pat Patterson would be The Special Guest Ring Announcer & Vince McMahon announced he would be The Special Guest Referee. He put Stone Cold in a Tag Team Match he didn't know who his partner was or who he would be facing. At the end of the night Austin found out he would be facing The Rock & D'Lo Brown & his partner was Vince McMahon. It ended up being a beat down on Austin. Then DX came out to make the save as did Dustin Rhodes. The next week on RAW IS WAR McMahon had Austin banned from the arena Austin beat up a Security Guard came out & challenged Vince McMahon, Gerald Brisco & Pat Patterson to a Street Fight. McMahon said he would get only 2 out of the 3. Austin was arrested but he was let go when he gave an apology to The Security Guard he beat up. Which it was a pretty funny apology  Austin faced Pat Patterson & Gerald Brisco in a Street Fight & Sergeant Slaughter was The Special Guest Referee. Austin had no problem with Patterson & Brisco but had Dude Love get involved while he was fighting Dude Love a "fan" with a Stone Cold mask on & had a cardboard sign that said h  e  l  l yeah on it attacked Stone Cold it was revealed to Vince McMahon. The next week on RAW IS WAR McMahon was proud to say he assaulted Stone Cold Steve Austin Austin turned the tables on McMahon he had him arrested along with Pat Patterson & Gerald Brisco. For the whole 1st hour of this episode of RAW Austin was taunting McMahon who was in the back of a Cop Car. Austin agreed to let McMahon go if he apologized Austin patted McMahon on the head & said he's a good kid. After McMahon was released he put Austin in a match with The Undertaker. McMahon made himself The Special Guest Referee. but McMahon was chokeslammed before the match could take place. Cause he was going insane due to Paul Bearer's mind games. Kane came out they got in a brawl. Austin came out he gave Stunner's to Patterson & Brisco he tied McMahon up on the ring ropes & was going to hit him with a chair Dude Love ran out with chair Austin hit Dude Love with a chair McMahon got away. Now I will talk about why The Undertaker was losing his mind on The April 27th episode of RAW IS WAR Paul Bearer told The Undertaker that Kane was his Son. The next week on RAW IS WAR a camera was left on & you could hear Jerry "The King" Lawler & Paul Bearer's conversation Paul Bearer told King how Undertaker & Kane's Mother wanted to have s  3  x with him that night he also said how he was almost caught by little Undertaker. That set off The Undertaker & attacked Paul Bearer & got in brawl with Kane. On The May 18th episode of RAW IS WAR it was revealed through D N A testing that Kane was Paul Bearer's Son. Paul Bearer said that Undertaker & Kane's Mother was nothing but a 2 bit w  ho  r  e. The Undertaker came out where he got in a fight with Kane but he was overpowered by Kane Vader came out he returned back at Unforgiven & got a mask vs mask match with Kane at this show. Anyway he evened things up Undertaker went after Paul Bearer. On The April 27th episode of RAW IS WAR during a tag team match Owen Hart turned on Ken Shamrock & he joined The Nation Owen brutally beat Ken Shamrock. The Nation quickly got in a rivalry with D Generation X. That is pretty much the backstory leading into this event. The buyrate was a 0.65 that is up from A Cold Day In H  e  ll from May of 97.The current champions in The WWF at the time wereWWF Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin March 29th 1998WWF Intercontinental Champion The Rock December 8th 1997 The Rock was awarded the title when then Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin refused to defend the title against The Rock in a mandatory title defenseWWF European Champion Triple H March 16th 1998 match aired March 17th 1998WWF Tag Team Champions The New Age Outlaws Road Dogg Jesse James & BA Billy Gunn March 30th 1998The Outlaws won held up titlesWWF Lightheavyweight Champion Taka Michinoku December 7th 1997Date May 31, 1998Attendance 9,822[1]Venue Wisconsin Center ArenaCity Milwaukee, WisconsinFree For Allthey show fans give their thoughts on who will win The WWF Championship match.Michael Cole interviewed Paul Bearer about Kane's mask vs mask with Vader. Paul Bearer said as a responsible parent he has to warn the kids watching this Pay Per View that if Kane unmasks it will be horrific.5 years later Kane unmasked & it really killed the character.The Nation came out & they were interviewed by Jerry "The King" Lawler The Rock said that Faarooq is no match for him. Then The King talked to Owen Hart regarding their match with DX. Owen said that he doesn't have to worry about DX ganging up on him cause he has all the family he needs. He said that Triple H was the 1 that started this. He also called the people of Milwaukee scum.An Attitude promo was shownMichael Cole talked to Marc Mero I don't care what he had to say.An ok video package was shown where highlights from The Mick Foley vs Terry Funk Hardcore Match.Michael Cole asked Vince McMahon if anybody took up the duty of being The Special Guest Enforcer for The WWF Championship match. Brisco said I heard that Ted Turner might be The Special Guest Enforcer tonight. Pat Patterson said it won't be Andre The Giant. McMahon said no one can intimidate him.Dok Hendrix interviewed D Generation X Triple H said that The Nation isn't even in out league their not even on the same Baseball Diamond as us. Road Dogg chimed in he said "As a matter of fact we don't want them playing with ourb  all  s anymore."The Undertaker interrupted them & DX walked off.Then we get to The Pay Per View which had a pretty good opening.LOD 2000 with Sunny & Droz Def The DOA Skull & 8 Ball with Chainz * & a half of a starThe Road Warriors  were irrelvant at this I didn't tell the why The Road Warriors & The DOA were facing each other. Back on The April 4th episode of RAW IS WAR The DOA got a shot at The WWF Tag Team Championship The LOD 2000 decided to team up with The DOA & make it an 8 Man Tag Team Match against D Generation X during the match The LOD 2000 & DOA got in a fight. Jim Ross mention that in 1984 The Road Warriors were The AWA World Tag Team Champions Jerry Lawler mention that in 1988 he was The AWA World Champion & he never came to Milwaukee. The LOD won with a powerslam which was unusual when they almost always win with The Doomsday Device.The Rock came out & cut a promo where he trashed the city of Milwaukee The Rock was attacked by Faarooq & he pilerove The Rock on a chair.  The Nation came out Faarooq got out of the ring.Michael Cole interviewed Stone Cold Steve Austin he said that Vince McMahon can stack the deck against me anyway he sees fit & he knows no one in the back will watch his back during his  match tonight cause they're all afraid of Vince McMahon he also said Vince McMahon's a  *  * will always belong to Stone Cold.Jeff Jarrett with Tennessee Lee Def Steve Blackman ** an ok matchDuring the match Al Snow made an appearance where he was at The Spanish Announcer's Table he was taken away by Security.Marc Mero Def Sable DUDI didn't tell the backstory on this match cause I didn't care for this storyline basically Mero told Sable that she was still under contract with him so she still has to accompany him to the ring Mero told her if she wants out of the contract then she will have to find someone to face him at Over The Edge if he beats who she chooses for his opponent she has to leave The WWF if her man she chooses beats him then Sable will be out of his contract. Mero laid down & tricked her & got the pin. No Sable wasn't gone & this storyline would still continue near the end of the year. I really wish that Mero would've just laid down let Sable get the pin end this storyline that should've ended at Wreslemania & Mero could've possibly joined Al Snow's Job Squad.When Michael Cole interviewed Sable I will admit Sable showed some of her most believable emotion.Dok Hendrix tried to get a word with The Nation but everybody was yelling3 on 2 handicap matchKaientaiSho FunakiTeioh& TogoDefBradshaw & Taka Michinoku ** an ok matchThe story behind this match was that Bradshaw & Taka Michinoku were attacked on various episodes of RAW in April & May The spots done by The Lightheavyweights made this match kind of enjoyable Bradshaw at this time was in his Stan Hansen gimmick however he was a pretty good power wrestler around this time. Also 1 thing I have to mention is that if you told me that Funaki would be in the company for almost 10 years I would've though you were lying.They show Sable leaving the arena.WWF Intercontinental ChampionshipChampion The Rock Def Faarooq * & half of a starhad The Rock been unable to defend the title Sergeant Slaughter would've stripped The Rock of the title & given it to Faarooq.The Rock won with his feet on the ropes Faarooq gave The Rock a couple of piledrivers The Nation came out to give a beat down on Faarooq but thenD Generation X came out to fight The Nation off.Mask vs MaskKane Def Vader * & half of a starWhen Paul Bearer put Vader's mask on that was funny. He lost The Big Van part of his name cause Vader was just a jobber at this point in his WWF run. Vader also cut 1 of the best bad promos in the world.Mad Dog Vachon & The Crusher were honored. Jerry Lawler decided to interrupt & give The Crusher &  Mad Dog a hard time. The Crusher scared "The King" off. Lawler went back into the ring & took Mad Dog's wooden leg off where he was chased off by The Crusher.6 Man Tag Team MatchThe NationOwen HartThe Godfather & D'Lo BrownDefD Generation XTriple HThe New Age OutlawsRoad Dogg Jesse James & BA Billy Gunn ** & 3 quarters of a stara really goo video package was shown for The WWF Championship match between Stone Cold Steve Austin & Dude LoveDok Hendrix interviewed Vince McMahon who said that if Stone Cold Steve Austin assaults him in anyway then he will strip Austin of The WWF Championship & award the title to Dude Love. He added that the match will only end by his hand only.WWF ChampionshipChampion Stone Cold Steve Austin Def Dude Love ****Vince McMahon was The Special Guest RefereePat Patterson was The Special Guest Ring AnnouncerGerald Brisco was The Special Guest Time KeeperThe Undertaker was The Special Guest EnforcerYou had some really long winded intro's by Pat Patterson.During the match McMahon added a No Disqualification stipulation & a Falls Count Anywhere stipulationThis was better than their match at Unforgiven after their match Austin & The Undertaker stared at each other knowing sooner or later they would face each other.A pretty good Pay Per View the undercard was so so nothing terrible most of the matches were either watchable or ok. The Road Warriors DOA match was watchable. Kane & Vader's match was mediocre while their No Way Out match wasn't good it was at least halfway decent. The DX vs The Nation 6 man tag was more than decent. The 3 on 2 handicap match was ok. Jeff Jarrett vs Steve Blackman was ok. The Intercontinental title match was watchable. The Stone Cold vs Dude Love match was great as I said better than their Unforgiven match.Pretty good Pay Per View however nothing you should buy right away unless it's cheap. Other than that find a stream online or buy it from a bootleg seller. Next old school Wrestling Pay Per View will be The 1998 King Of The Ring & we all know what happened there.
summary: Over The Edge In Your House review 7/10
Title: WWF In Your House 22 - Over The Edge VHS

reviewText: The main feud heading into Over The Edge 1998 was Stone Cold Steve Austin's continued feud with Vince McMahon and Dude Love put in the middle of it. Failing to adapt to Vince McMahon's corporate demands, McMahon found a superstar willing to take the strap off Austin: Dude Love. However; Austin, McMahon, and Foley would have to look over their shoulder, as The Undertaker lurked in the shadows, hungry for the WWF Championship1.) LOD 2000 w/Sunny and Puke a.k.a. Droz vs DOA (8-Ball and Skull) w/ChainzThe show opens with a slow but decent tag team match from LOD 2000 and DOA. Sunny looked smoking hot....as always! I think her LOD attire is probably her best attire ever. Animal hits a powerslam on 8-Ball to win the match. I never cared for DOA as a tag team and I don't think the fans did either as they never really got a reaction from the crowd__________________________________________________________________________________________________The Rock comes out and hits a heel promo on Milwaukee, leading to Faarooq coming out and attacking The Rock and grabs a steel chair. Rock steals it from Farrooq and tries to hit Faarooq with it but he hits the ropes, causing the chair to ricochet in his face. Faarooq drops Rock with a piledriver on the chair and he flees as the Nation comes to Rock's aid and Rock gets stretchered out. We find out later that Commissioner Slaughter announces that The Rock will defend the title against Faarooq later on, or else he'll be stripped of it and awarded to Faarooq__________________________________________________________________________________________________2.) Jeff Jarrett w/Tennessee Lee vs Steve BlackmanWe follow up with a really great back and forth action match between Blackman and Jarrett. The match ends with Tennessee Lee nailing Blackman with one of his kendo sticks behind the referee's back and Jarrett getting the pinfall victory__________________________________________________________________________________________________3.) Marc Mero vs SableThe background of this story was that Marc Mero told Sable to find an opponent for him to fight at the PPV. If he won, Sable was free from Mero but if Mero won, Sable would have to leave the WWF forever. Sable came to the ring and decided she didn't need a man to fight her battles and that she'd win her freedom herself. Mero suddenly has a change of heart and decides he doesn't want their relationship to end this way, so he lays down to let Sable pin him. Sable pins Mero, but in a slick swerve, he reversed her pin into an inside cradle for the 1, 2, 3. This was a pretty hilarious ending to the match and definitely had Mero earn some pointers in my book. Mero tells Sable to get out of the WWF and sings the goodbye song to her as Sable walks away with her head down. Sable soon after cuts a promo backstage where she thanks the fans for their support and says goodbye. Horrible acting from Sable but a comical segment with Mero in the ring__________________________________________________________________________________________________4.) 3 on 2 Handicap Match: Kaientai (Dick Togo, Mens Teioh, and Sho Funaki) w/Yamaguchi-San vs Taka Michinoku and Justin BradshawA decent cruiserweight/light heavyweight match. There was some hilarious mid-match commentary from J.R. and Lawler when Lawler ranted on about Sable and J.R tells Jerry he's a lonely guy and needs couch time. The crowd was silent for most of them is one. Taka gets worked over for most of the match until he gets the tag to Bradshaw who destroys Kaientai. In the end Togo gets the win for Kaientai following a Senton Bomb on Taka.__________________________________________________________________________________________________5.) WWF Intercontinental Championship Match: Faarooq vs The RockThe Rock's music plays twice and he never shows. Commissioner Slaughter comes out and orders The Rock to come to the ring as he counts down from 10 to 1. Rock's music hits as Slaughter counts down to 2 and out comes The Rock wearing a neck brace from the piledriver earlier tonight. A rather disappointing match that ends with The Rock rolling up Faarooq with his feet on the ropes to retain the title. This match lasts around 5 minutes and it honestly should've lasted a bit longer, given how the build-up of this feud went. Faarooq gives Rock 2 piledrivers following the match, leading to the Nation coming out and putting a beat down on their former leader. This leads to DX coming down for the save and a pier 6 brawl breaking out between the 2 factions.__________________________________________________________________________________________________6.) Mask vs Mask: Kane w/Paul Bearer vs VaderIn a rematch from their February No Way Out match, both Kane and Vade put their masks on the line. Fans would either see Kane's severely burned face or Vader's damaged face that had been smushed by Kane at the No Way Out PPV with a wrench. Vader misses a moonsault on Kane and the Big Red Machine capitalizes with a Tombstone Piledriver for the win. Kane takes Vader's mask off and puts it on Paul Bearer and mocks Vader. Michael Cole interviews Vader following the match where Vader weirdly calls himself "a big fat piece of s***".__________________________________________________________________________________________________There's an in-ring segment where legends Mad Dog Vachon (RIP) and The Crusher honored. Jerry Lawler crashes the honoring ceremony and says it's 1998 not 1948. Lawler rips Vachon's fake leg off and swings it at The Crusher and throws it at him. Lawler comes back for more and Crusher clocks Lawler with the leg. I feel bad but I kind of laughed seeing Jerry swing the leg around at Crusher__________________________________________________________________________________________________7.) 6 Man Tag Team Match: DX (Triple H, Billy Gunn, and Road Dogg) w/X-Pac and Chyna vs The Nation (Owen Hart, Kama, and D'Lo Brown) w/Mark HenryAmazing 6 man Tag Team match from these 2 teams! I didn't start watching WWF until 1999 but the DX vs Nation feud is one of my favorites from the Attitude Era. Lots of back and forth action from both teams that was just amazing. Chaos ensues at the end and while the referee is dealing with outside drama between DX and The Nation, Owen Pedigrees Triple H on the European Championship to get the win__________________________________________________________________________________________________8.) WWF Championship Match: Dude Love vs Stone Cold Steve Austin (c)  (Special Referee: Vince McMahon)Pat Patterson was the guest ring announcer for the match, while Gerald Briscoe served as the guest timekeeper for the match. We got a long opening segment with Patterson giving ridiculously long but funny introductions to Brisco, McMahon, Foley, and Austin. J.R.'s commentary during these introductions was just downright hilarious. Before the match got started, The Undertaker made his grand entrance, who would be keeping watch of the match at ringside to ensure McMahon played a fair referee. This match was just awesome! I feel that the Dude Love vs Stone Cold feud altogether is extremely underrated when it comes to the Attitude Era. To try and screw over Austin more and more, McMahon would throw in out of the blue stipulations such as No DQ and Falls Count Anywhere. The match spills outside of the ring and up the walkway and Undertaker, Brisco, and Patterson follow to watch the action. Dude ends up busting Stone Cold open with an exhaust pipe which adds drama to the storytelling of the match. As the match goes back to the ring, Dude accidentally knocks McMahon out with a steel chair shot, similar to how Austin accidentally knocked McMahon out with a steel chair at their Unforgiven match. Dude KOs Austin with the Mandible Claw and both Patterson and Brisco attempt to count the pin for Dude but Undertaker Chokeslams them both through the ringside announce tables. Austin hits the Stunner on Dude and uses the hand of McMahon to count the 3 pin for the title retain. Undertaker and Austin have a stare down that would set off a chain events for their feud in 1998. Over The Edge 1998 goes off the air with Stone Cold celebrating his victory in all his splendor.Overall: Over The Edge 1998 was just amazing! 1998 was a really great year for WWF, and the Attitude Era wasn't even at its peak yet! We open with a pretty good tag team match between DOA and LOD, accompanied by the ever eye gazing babe, Sunny. Unfortunately this would be Sunny's last WWF PPV appearance until Wrestlemania 25 as she would be released in early July 1998 due to drama with Sable and a rumor of her being addicted to painkillers. But aside all that, we also saw a solid match from Jeff Jarrett and Steve Blackman, a short but sweet match from Kane and Vader, a great 6 Man Tag match between DX and The Nation and a classic and underrated main event from Steve Austin and Foley! If you haven't already, I highly recommend checking out Austin and Foley's match at Unforgiven as well as this one. They were both off the charts! I'm a bit surprised that Over The Edge didn't do well in buy rates because the PPV was terrific. Perhaps VHS sales did better. But overall, Over The Edge 98 receives a 5/5 stars from me!
summary: A Really Good PPV That Should Be Watched By All Fans Of And From The Attitude Era
Title: WWF In Your House 22 - Over The Edge VHS
